rev.comment: /* Police violence at Occupy UC Davis */
rev.diff:
Line 47: Line 47:
The 35 or so officers present said that they had felt surrounded as several hundred demonstrators had gathered. 10 were arrested and two officers have been suspended.<ref name = âCSMâ>[http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1120/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-incident-goes-viral/%28page%29/2 Brad Knickerbocker, âUC Davis pepper spray incident goes viralâ, The Christian Science Monitor, 20 November 2011]</ref>
The 35 or so officers present said that they had felt surrounded as several hundred demonstrators had gathered. 10 were arrested and two officers have been suspended.<ref name = âCSMâ>[http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1120/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-incident-goes-viral/%28page%29/2 Brad Knickerbocker, âUC Davis pepper spray incident goes viralâ, The Christian Science Monitor, 20 November 2011]</ref>
â
According to participants, one of the officers who used [[pepper spray]] was identified as Lieutenant John Pike of Davis, California. <ref>[http://www.huliq.com/10178/video-pepper-spray-aftermath-uc-davis-professor-demands-chancellors-resignation "Video In pepper spray aftermath"]</ref> He has since been suspended from duty and is on administrative leave. <ref>http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/nov/20/uc-davis-pepper-spray-video</ref> Another involved officer was placed on administrative leave, as was UC Davis Police Chief Annette Spicuzza.<ref>[http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/uc-davis-police-chief-put-leave-tensions-continue-rise-pepper-spray-incident-article-1.980841?localLinksEnabled=false UC Davis police chief put on leave as tensions continue to rise after pepper spray incident]
+
According to participants, one of the officers who used [[pepper spray]] was identified as Lieutenant John Pike of Davis, California. <ref>[http://www.huliq.com/10178/video-pepper-spray-aftermath-uc-davis-professor-demands-chancellors-resignation "Video In pepper spray aftermath"]</ref> He has since been suspended from duty and is on administrative leave. <ref>http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/nov/20/uc-davis-pepper-spray-video</ref> Another involved officer was placed on administrative leave, as was UC Davis Police Chief Annette Spicuzza.<ref>[http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/uc-davis-police-chief-put-leave-tensions-continue-rise-pepper-spray-incident-article-1.980841?localLinksEnabled=false UC Davis police chief put on leave as tensions continue to rise after pepper spray incident]</ref>
